meanings.definition: The rank or title of an earl.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the brave knight inherited the earldom from his father.
meanings.sent2: The earldom was passed down through generations in the noble family.
meanings.sent3: The earldom was so prestigious that even the king admired it.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she ruled her own earldom when she hosted a grand feast.
meanings.sent5: The earldom shone brightly in the history books as a symbol of power.

meanings.definition: The territory or jurisdiction of an earl.
meanings.sent1: The vast forests and fields made up the earldom of the noble earl.
meanings.sent2: The people in the earldom looked up to their wise ruler for guidance.
meanings.sent3: The earldom's borders were well-guarded by loyal knights.
meanings.sent4: She explored every corner of the earldom, feeling like an adventurous explorer.
meanings.sent5: The earldom's beauty was unmatched, with rolling hills and sparkling rivers.
